title.narrative: Expanding agribusiness and agro processing to incentivise commercially oriented agriculltural production for food security, increased incomes and employment diversification in Burundi

description.narrative:
A Dutch based company (Zazou ) group, having been requested by the ministry of agriculture in Burundi to support value chain development, approached UNIDO to partner in the development and implementation of an agro value chain development project. The Sustainable Development Goals Partnership (SDGP) facility would fund the project, a consortium of Dutch companies would invest in the processing (anchor) plant and UNIDO would play the role of Knowledge institution i.e. bringing in their global experience in value chain development and capacity building in the partnership.
The purpose of the project is to create employment diversification, and to contribute to food security and nutrition in Burundi by upgrading the horticulture sub sector. The project seeks to provide technical assistance to the Government of Burundi to expand agribusiness and agro-processing as a way of creating a shift from the current subsistence to commercial agricultural production. By building the capacities of producers towards a business oriented production, and improving the capacity for post harvest loss management, and increasing value addition the horticulture chain can play a pivotal role in improving the livelihoods of the target beneficiaries. Further capacity building and optimization of all operations along the horticulture value chain can integrate Burundi small scale horticulture producers into global value chains leading to higher incomes for their products.
The project will specifically address the following (1) increasing productivity per unit area of production (ii) reducing post harvest losses (iii) increasing value addition. It is expected that expanded operations along the horticulture value will have a catalytic effect not only on production intensification, but in the emergence of other agro-allied industries that provide services and inputs to the sector providing the much needed trigger to employment diversification.
The project will be implemented in two phases mainly the inception and implementation phase. The inception phase will focus on data and information collection and analysis for use in crafting the workplans and business plans for the main implementation phase. The implementation phase will focus on capacity building, technology transfer and the establishment of market linkages.
